title: In the 5th Crusade, the crusader armies allied with the Sultanate of Rûm in order to fight the Ayyubids in Egypt. Why would both Christians and Muslims so readily fight alongside each other in a religiously motivated war? - Quora

response.answer_text: War is the ultimate form of politics, religion is for the masses. Same way as france often allied with the ottoman empire despite being a catholic country. Nothing new in history, hell Turkey is “against” ISIS at least on paper, and would likely switch alegiance the second they thought that ISIS would get world domination.

The simple answer is power politics. After all, the enemy of my enemy is my friend, right? At least until the war is over. If you play your cards right, your temporary ally may be so weakened by the war that you can finish him off afterwards.
